metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19888 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An invalid memory address dereference was discovered in the huffcodefunction (libfaac/huff2.c) in Freeware Advanced Audio Coder (FAAC)1.29.9.2. The vulnerability causes a segmentation fault and applicationcrash, which leads to denial of service in the HCB_ESC case.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

faac - 1.30-1
libfaac0 - 1.30-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: faac package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.30-1').
